=== About this page ===

This is a planning page for marketing of Edubuntu and Ubuntu in Education

It will be used by:
* Canonical Marketing
** Gerry Carr
* Ubuntu Education Programme Manager
** Richard Weideman
* PRO Agency
** Joseph Eckhart
** Lauree Ostrofsky

== Education Marketing Outline ==

=== Overall Objectives ===

* To increase the visibility of Edubuntu and Ubuntu usage in education
* To promote the successes of Edubuntu and Ubuntu usage in education
* To bring Edubuntu and Ubuntu top of mind for Education Linux for the following audiences:
** Journalists - Technical
** Journalists - Non-Technical
** Education Decision Makers
** Educators
** Learners

=== Release Objective ===

* Release one publicity item per month in each of the scheduled item categories below
* This equates to a repeat cycle every quarter

=== Publicity Item Categories ===

==== Scheduled Items ====

* '''Customer Win (Technical)'''
** ''generally a press release distributed broadly and pitched to appropriate media''

* '''Customer Storie (Emotional)'''
** ''generally a carefully pitched story with follow up press release''

* '''Product Announcement'''
** ''Press release and pitched story placements''

==== Unscheduled Items ====

* '''Byline'''
** ''Carefully crafted outlines (first) that show industry and technology leadership''

* '''Reactive interviews'''
** ''Accept as many incoming releases as the above (and general buzz) produce''

* '''Proactive interviews'''
** ''Last stage, develop specific pitches for larger issue stories, building on the results of the above.''

=== Action Plan ===

* Next steps/stages:
** Identify customer wins and case studies.
** Discuss merits/timing of each.
** Identify product announcement roadmap.
** Discuss timing and news value to each.
** Craft byline outline
** Create target publication list
